
{{alias}}( x, n, b )
    Rounds a numeric value to the nearest multiple of `b^n` toward positive
    infinity.

    Due to floating-point rounding error, rounding may not be exact.

    Parameters
    ----------
    x: double
        Input value.

    n: integer
        Integer power.

    b: integer
        Base.

    Returns
    -------
    y: double
        Rounded value.

    Examples
    --------
    // Round to 4 decimal places:
    > var v = {{alias}}( 3.14159, -2, 10 )
    3.1416

    // If `n = 0` or `b = 1`, standard round behavior:
    > v = {{alias}}( 3.14159, 0, 2 )
    4.0

    // Round to nearest multiple of two toward positive infinity:
    > v = {{alias}}( 5.0, 1, 2 )
    6.0
